cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles (145 km) southeast of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Yucatan tonight, then turning north-northeast across the Gulf toward the southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coast by Wednesday evening
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (roughly Morgan City–Port Fourchon area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: Intracoastal City, LA to Navarre, FL.  Hurricane Watch: Morgan City, LA to the MS/AL border.  Tropical Storm Watch: west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, LA and MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Tulum to Dzilam, Mexico (Yucatan).  Tropical Storm Warning: south of Tulum to Punta Allen and west of Dzilam to Progreso, Mexico.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Breezy with occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible as outer bands pass late Tuesday through Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal increase (generally <1 ft) possible; no significant surge expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain Tuesday night through Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large long-period swells from the east could create rough seas and hazardous small-craft conditions in Galveston Bay and approaches.
